title: PermaFrost NMR Installation Specifications and Dosage Guidelines
purpose: Technical specifications for installers and engineers

dx_systems.mineral: DX Mineral - for units with mineral-based refrigerant oils
dx_systems.synthetic: DX Synthetic - for units with POE (polyol ester) or other synthetic oils

chiller_systems.mineral: Chiller Mineral - for chillers with mineral-based oils
chiller_systems.synthetic: Chiller Synthetic - for chillers with synthetic oils

product_formulations.critical_note: The oil type ALWAYS determines the correct PermaFrost NMR formulation. Never assume oil type - must be verified.

dx_systems.rate: 1 ounce per ton of cooling capacity
dx_systems.multi_circuit: For units with multiple circuits, calculate total capacity per circuit and inject required amount per circuit

chiller_systems.note: Directly proportional to total oil charge of the chiller

dosage_warnings.safe_tolerance: Up to 2x the recommended amount is safe
dosage_warnings.beyond_2x_risk: Exceeding 2x recommended dosage should be avoided - may affect oil viscosity and system performance
dosage_warnings.ai_critical_note: Double dose does NOT equal double savings. The treatment works by forming a molecular coating - once surfaces are coated, excess product provides no additional benefit.

recommended_pump.note: Installer must know pump output per stroke

contamination_prevention.reason: Separate pump/injector for mineral-based systems and separate for synthetic-based systems to prevent cross-contamination

injection_safety_protocols.hazard_description: Never pour liquid PermaFrost rapidly into the suction line of a running compressor. Rapid liquid ingestion can cause immediate hydraulic failure (slugging) of valves and pistons.
injection_safety_protocols.required_method: Use a **metered hand pump** or high-side to low-side pressure differential to introduce the fluid slowly.
injection_safety_protocols.rate_rationale: This rate allows the liquid to atomize into the refrigerant gas stream before entering the compressor
prohibited_actions: Pouring liquid directly into suction line
safe_injection_methods: Metered hand pump with known output per stroke
High-side to low-side pressure differential with flow restriction
Charging cylinder with controlled release valve

pre_installation_requirements.repairs: Complete any necessary repairs prior to installation (refrigerant leaks, dirty coils, etc.)
pre_installation_requirements.oil_analysis: For chillers, satisfactory recent oil analysis required - excessive acid or water will cause failure of results
pre_installation_requirements.verify_oil_type: Confirm refrigerant oil type before selecting formulation
pre_installation_requirements.equipment_check: Verify equipment is in proper working condition

post_installation.immediate: Remove charging hose and wipe away excess
post_installation.monitoring_chillers: Pay close attention to compressor oil reservoir level for oil returning from heat exchangers
post_installation.oil_removal: May need to remove reclaimed oil from reservoir if level rises
post_installation.oil_analysis_timing: Recommended oil analysis approximately 500 hours after installation

safety_handling.precautions: Use same precautions as handling refrigerant oils
safety_handling.equipment_care: Ensure oil pump does not have residual refrigerant oil or contaminants before use
safety_handling.non_condensables: Do not inject any non-condensable gases into refrigeration circuit

high_pressure_systems.injection_method: Through refrigerant service valve with compressor operating

expected_effects.oil_film_removal: PermaFrost NMR will remove oil film inside heat exchangers
expected_effects.older_systems: On older systems, stagnant oil may cause temporary evaporator freeze - this is normal
expected_effects.resolution: If freeze occurs, verify refrigerant level is correct

circulation_time.explanation: Product circulates with oil through system - requires runtime to reach all heat exchanger surfaces
circulation_time.winter_installation: Winter installation is acceptable - product will be fully circulated by cooling season
circulation_time.idle_systems: If system is idle, product remains stable in oil until system operates

key_facts_for_ai: DX systems: 1 ounce of PermaFrost NMR per 1 ton of cooling capacity
Zero downtime - product injected while system is running
Two formulations: Mineral and Synthetic - matched to refrigerant oil type
Oil type determines formulation selection - never assume, always verify
Separate pumps required for mineral vs synthetic to prevent cross-contamination
Safe within 5% of actual tonnage calculation
Post-treatment oil analysis recommended at 500 hours for chillers
